tagged_story_for_tts:
<[silence:3600]>

The word magnetism traces its roots to the Ancient Greek magnētis lithos <[silence:250]> meaning "stone from Magnesia" <[silence:1200]>
This refers to lodestones <[silence:250]> naturally magnetic iron ore <[silence:250]> discovered near Magnesia <[silence:250]> an ancient city in Asia Minor <[silence:1200]>
By the thirteenth century <[silence:250]> the term entered Old French as magnetisme <[silence:250]> before evolving into its modern English form <[silence:1200]

Three related concepts are electromagnetism <[silence:250]> ferromagnetism <[silence:250]> and diamagnetism <[silence:3600]>
clean_story:
The word magnetism traces its roots to the Ancient Greek magnētis lithos  meaning "stone from Magnesia" 
This refers to lodestones  naturally magnetic iron ore  discovered near Magnesia  an ancient city in Asia Minor 
By the thirteenth century  the term entered Old French as magnetisme  before evolving into its modern English form <[silence:1200]

Three related concepts are electromagnetism  ferromagnetism  and diamagnetism
